name: lobed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
biology (of a leaf) having rounded or pointed parts that stick out from the main part: The mature leaves are deeply lobed, often curling at the edges. Some varieties have more handsomely lobed foliage than others.
anatomy (of an organ such as the brain, lungs, or liver) having a part or parts that seem to be separate in some way from the rest: The pancreas is a small, white, lobed organ lying below the kidneys.
More examplesFewer examplesMost grape vines produce deeply lobed leaves.The glossy oval leaves are deeply lobed towards tips.The most important aspect of the ovary is whether it is lobed or not.
